result.execSummary:
The defendant Ricardo A. Vasquez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.
Motion for expunction upon successful completion of probation is DENIED.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Pay costs of legal representation or Advocate Counsel fees for the defense of the case, to be determined within 60 days.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.   
*  Pay costs of legal representation or Advocate Counsel fees for the defense of the case, to be determined within 60 days.  
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Angela Komp.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved; plea questionnaire filed.  Deft. pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  PSI is waived by parties.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence is withheld; Deft. placed on probation for 2 years consecutive to any other sentence. See conditions.  As a condition court imposes and stays 3 years and 6 months in the WSP; 1 yr 6 mo Initial Confinement followed by 2 years Extended Supervision.  Motion for expunction upon successful completion of probation is denied.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning and Voting Acknowledgement given.

120 p.m.  Atty Jerrold Hinshaw appeared as Special Prosecutor for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney A Komp.  Clk  LE.  Referred to Br 8 for further dispo on 11/13/14 @ 930 a.m.  Information filed previously  Not Guilty plea enterd.  Scheduling order given.  Bond - Continued.
